title: Daily Note - 2025-06-28
summary: Productive day focused on improving the Collapsi RL training system and completing an academic paper analysis project. Key achievements include implementing session timestamps and architecture preservation for RL training, integrating MCTS with PPO, fixing codebase diagnostics, and transforming academic paper summaries into comprehensive technical documents.
methods: model evaluation system with tournaments and heatmap visualizations
accomplishments: Implemented session timestamps for training checkpoints on Collapsi RL
Added complete architecture preservation in Collapsi RL checkpoints
Created comprehensive model evaluation system for Collapsi RL with tournaments and heatmap visualizations
Integrated Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) with PPO training for enhanced Collapsi gameplay
Fixed all type checking and diagnostic issues across the Collapsi codebase
Rewrote README.md and updated CLAUDE.md documentation for Collapsi
Completed comprehensive analysis and enrichment of all academic papers
Transformed basic summaries into 300+ line technical documents for academic papers
Added deep mathematical frameworks and theoretical implications to academic paper analyses
Connected academic research to broader literature in optimal transport, control theory, and statistical mechanics
Created publication-quality academic analyses suitable for graduate reference
Set up initial repository for Interactive CV project with academic profiles and paper analyses
Created comprehensive academic profile for Interactive CV with research style and technical mastery sections
Made initial git commit preserving all academic work
insights: Session timestamps are crucial for preventing checkpoint confusion in long training runs.
MCTS integration can add significant Elo strength (200-400 Elo) but comes with a high computational cost (50x).
Monte Carlo returns work better than GAE for short-horizon games like Collapsi.
A systematic paper analysis methodology produces significantly better academic documentation.
learning: MCTS implementation patterns for two-player games
Terminal outcome prediction as auxiliary loss improves credit assignment in RL
future_work: Start comparative training runs for Standard PPO vs PPO+MCTS
Set up GitHub repository for interactive CV project
Begin frontend development for interactive CV presentation
